alert.note: Alert for Northern Jackson; Southern Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 1:36PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF JACKSON COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM CDT... At 136 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing funnel clouds over Vancleave, or 7 miles northwest of Escatawpa, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, winds in excess of 30 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moss Point, Escatawpa, Gautier, Wade, Helena, Big Point, Hurley, Vancleave, and Hickory Hills. This includes Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 57 and 74. FUNNEL CLOUDS...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
